result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanna Marie Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM   Defendant Deanna Marie Johnson in court with attorney Joseph James Kaupie.  Defendant Deanna Marie Johnson in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kaupie presents the agreement of the parties that has been reached for four cases in which probation is revoked (15CF204,15CF154,17CF12,17CM188) and two new cases (18CF215 & 18CF317) that were assigned to Judge Yackel, but are now being heard by Judge Anderson for judicial economy as per the agreement of both Judges.
Atty Poquette adds that preliminary hearing would need to be addressed/waived in 18CF317 prior to proceeding, and that any previously ordered financial orders from the revoked cases would continue as ordered.  
11:23 am Atty Poquette makes statement.  Court inquires and State verifies any victims rights legislation if applicable has been complied with.  
11:28 am Atty Kaupie makes statement.   11:36 am Defendant makes statement.
11:41 Court: Will follow agreement.  

15CF204 Count #3.   Probation has been revoked.   
Sentenced.  332 days county jail, with credit for 332 TIME SERVED.  Any previously ordered financial obligations remain as ordered, remaining balance to be converted to Clerk of Court collect, civil judgment entered, subject to tax intercept.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 17, 2019 at 11:00 am.
15CF154 & 15CF204 assigned to Judge John Anderson; 17CF12 & 17CM188 assigned to Judge John Yackel
JOSEPH KAUPIE REPLACING RYAN REID
